intro: Syncolostemon latidens, commonly known as the broadleaf synclast, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
